instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A without green light.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V

On <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> I only get 8.17V and on  <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> I get 0.027V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
Must fix <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> first.
Post <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages (all pins).
If all good, remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and test the signal again.
Check <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> and be sure J6100 is clean.
If still the same, remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and check if signal goes high.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> had 50K and I replaced. Now it has 97K ohm

J6100 seams OK

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>:
1=3.4V
2=0V
3=3.4V
4=2.751V
5=0.115V
6=3.4V
7=3.4V
8=3.298V

It seams that  <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  is low. Shall I replace <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
Why didn't do the mentioned tests?
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low for some reason...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
I didn't do the tests because I  thought that the value of pin 5 was bad, and  thought that there was no reason to proced (my bad).

Even without  <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and without  <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, I get 0.99V on  <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

I think that something is burning <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>, because I already replaced 3, and the third is bad again (23k ohm). It seams that it burns with powering on after a few tries (not sure if it makes any sense...)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> was never burnt.
Onboard measurment will always show lower value.

You have a problem with SMC, or accumulated crap underneath.
Try first reballing it.
If still the same, change SMC.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
It was the SMC. The reball was  enough.

TKS!
